result.execSummary:
The defendant Jayme T. Inman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  PD - Aileen Henry.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  19,482.80 (determined)   plus surcharges.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances.  May not have contact with Jeffrey S, Wm & Cindy Z, Frances & Jessica E, Marty & Elizabeth K.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim(s) present.  Brief discussion held.  Court orders that the deft either reach an agrement w/the victim on the amount of restitution which will be satisfied by the transfer of a good title or the court will issue a judicial sale.  Atty Henry takes a few minutes to speak w/her client.  Court reconvenes.  Deft agrees to sign/transfer the vehicle over to the victim to have them sell the vehicle and have the money taken off the restitution amount.  Victim will notify the parties of the sell amount.  IF there is a dispute in the amount of the sale of the vehicle, the court will conduct a hrg.  Title given to the victim in court.  Court approves the restitution amount ordered by Comm. Dowse subject to this issue.
Probation review hearing on March 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Comm. Dowse's Court Notes - SEALED
LETC and recommended RO forwarded to Br. 3.
State 1-  Exhibit #1 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 02-16-15 -  jt

925 Clerk HM.     Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  DE appears in custody and with Atty Henry.   Partial agreement.   Remaining issues - two pieces of jewelry, price of a gun and what to do with a car owned by DE - victim requesting title be turned over to her, vehicle sold and amt received deducted from total amt of restitution ordered.   Victim, E.K., sworn in and testified.    DE Jayme Inman, sworn in and testified.  VI recalled.  Court hears argument.   Court orders restitution at $200 for earrings and bracelet.   No dispute about amt of cash taken.   Court orders state to determine a new average for the gun - that amt will be the order for restitution.  Parties shall discuss all amts and report to court.    (off record)    947  Amt of gun agreed upon will be $5080 bringing  the total amt of restitution to $19,842.80.   So ordered.  Court will render a written decision re: DE's vehicle.

Minutes:  14CF655/14CF677/14CF700.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim rights compliance; victim statement made by Elizabeth K.  Sentencing arguments made.

14CF677 - (Ct 1) deft sentenced to 11yrs WSP; initial confinement of 6 yrs followed by 5 yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for ERP or SAP.  Credit for 151 days. 

ALL remaining counts in all three files - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 5 yrs on each count concurrent but CONSEC to count 1 of 14CF677.  Probation conditions identical to those of ES.  Deft stipulates to restitution in files 14CF655 & 14CF700.  Restitution TBD in 14CF677.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

Minutes:  14CF655/14CF677/14CF700.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

14CF655 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

14CF677 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

14CF700 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

13CM1531/13CM1532/14CM799 - files are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.
